Why It's a Top Resource: The primary benchmark dataset with over 12,600 labeled hand X-rays. It is the most widely used resource for training and validating bone age models.
The original challenge that spurred much of the innovation in this field. The results and discussions provide valuable insights into baseline models.

Title / Source: BAE-ViT: An Efficient Multimodal Vision Transformer
Why It's a Top Resource: Introduces a Vision Transformer (ViT) that incorporates both image and demographic data (age, gender), outperforming traditional CNNs.

Title / Source: Bone age assessment based on deep neural networks with region extraction
Why It's a Top Resource: A highly-cited paper detailing a modern, two-stage pipeline: it first localizes key bone regions and then feeds them into a gender-assisted network.

Title / Source: Bone age estimation with HS-optimized ResNet and YOLO
Why It's a Top Resource: A cutting-edge hybrid approach that uses YOLO for precise Region of Interest (ROI) detection before classification with an optimized ResNet.

Title / Source: Self-accumulative Vision Transformer for Bone Age Assessment
Why It's a Top Resource: Presents an advanced Vision Transformer architecture that uses multi-view and multi-task learning, achieving high accuracy with fewer parameters.

Title / Source: An Unsupervised Deep-Learning Method for Bone Age
Why It's a Top Resource: A novel approach using an unsupervised autoencoder to cluster bone age intervals, reducing the need for large labeled datasets.

Title / Source: A ROI Extraction Method for Wrist Imaging Applied in Smart Bone-Age Assessment
Why It's a Top Resource: Details a highly accurate YOLO-based model specifically for detecting and extracting wrist ROIs, which is a critical preprocessing step.

Title / Source: Impact of Ensemble Learning in the Assessment of Skeletal Maturity
Why It's a Top Resource: Demonstrates how combining multiple models (bagging, stacking) can significantly improve the accuracy and robustness of bone age predictions.

Title / Source: Deeplasia: deep learning for bone age assessment
Why It's a Top Resource: Presents an open-source tool validated on patients with skeletal dysplasias, demonstrating the model's utility in challenging clinical cases.

Title / Source: A comparison of two AI-based methods: BoneXpert and VUNO Med-Bone Age
Why It's a Top Resource: Provides real-world context by evaluating and comparing two commercial AI systems, showing their high level of agreement with manual methods.

Title / Source: CNNs vs ViT - Medical Image Classification Repository
Why It's a Top Resource: An invaluable practical resource, this GitHub repository provides code for comparing CNN and Vision Transformer performance on medical imaging tasks.
